title: What do you do during your commute to work?
body:
On my way to work, I was thinking about what other people do in the car while they're on their way to work.  Most people look so bored. (not that I can blame them, LA traffic is terrible.)

* Sing as loud as I want to my favorite songs
* Replace lyrics in songs with other words, trying to sing the full song
* Try and think up new programming ideas or expand on old ones
* People watch.

So, whatcha doin?!

replies.body:
I walk from my bedroom to my computer and sit down. While my computer boots up, I eat blueberries.

... Working from home has potentially spoiled me.

I did that in my job before Riot. I went downstairs to get some Keurig coffee and toast, then padded back upstairs in my fancy business slippers and flopped into my high-end leather chair, careful not to wrinkle my impeccable pink-striped terry-cloth bathrobe.  

I miss those days, but only on Mondays. The rest of the days I'm so glad to come in to these amazing dudes and gals I am honored to call co-Rioters.

Also, the coffeeshop here is *hella better* than a cuppa Keurig...
I was thinking of picking up a Keurig today (Depends on how swirly I feel). That and maybe restocking my supply of deathwish coffee...
What specifically do you do? I mean I know that your title is QA Analyst, but what do you *do* ?
You stay away from them there Northern words, Southerner.

I can't work from home for more than a few days, haha. I start getting antsy and feeling like I'm trapped in my house.  Most of the time when I work from home, I end up eating out for lunch so that I at least have a reason to get out of my pajamas and leave the house.
Pajamas? When I work from home...let's just say I'm also in my "pajamas." Yeah...
I intensely focus on the road ahead of me so I don't run into the cars on either side (motorcycle commuter)

Yeaaaaaaah, no thanks. As for motorcycle commuters, I try and give them as much space as possible while letting them know that I see them. I try and always keep an eye behind me and my blindspots for the guys lanesplitting, as I would hate to endanger them.

Good guy RiotGradius, plz don't kill me.


In all seriousness though I feel much less safe when I bicycle commute than when I motorcycle commute in this city
Shadow of the Colossus soundtrack
I actually fall asleep to this soundtrack a lot of nights... lol! :)
There's always radio talk shows and audiobooks.

Audiobooks are something that I've always wanted to get into more, but I'm cursed(blessed?) with a commute that's under 20 minutes most of the time so I feel like it would take me 2 years to get through a single audiobook!

For audiobooks, it's about capturing all the bits of time when your mind doesn't need to be specifically focused on a task. I listen to audiobooks during commutes, exercising, doing chores, or certain hobbies like sketching or painting.
What service do you use?  Not to detract from the original post, but Audible doesn't seem like it holds the greatest value.
I do use Audible. I find it valuable, but then I get through about a book a month and it's just part of my entertainment budget.

Roger, thanks for the feedback.  My only caveat with the service is that one book a month doesn't seem like a ton of content, but I've heard many a contrary opinion.  I'll have to revisit it sometime.
Mostly listen to Sci-fi audio books while riding my scooter :)
Good man! Sci-fi all the way!
I like to listen to podcasts, specifically LoL related ones like trinity force podcast
Podcasts are a great way to spend time when you're in the car.  I've always enjoyed them because I feel like I'm actually spending my time to learn something rather than just sitting there.
Nintendo 3DS, baby! Currently playing Mario and Luigi: Dream Team. Bravely Default is next..

I can't find a job right now, so... :/

I really thought it would be easier to get hired with a Master's degree, but it appears I was wrong.

Hack.
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/BsiZ7Z9CQAAv18q.jpg

It's really sad you've picked the wrong side though :(

(also, maybe I should install Ingress again)

"wrong side"

says the bandwagoning Resistance guy who doesn't even play anymoar
... It feels like you were there when I was convinced to play this game. :P
I keep my eyes on the freaking road. Jeez. :P

mostly thinking about life/work/daytoday-problems...or just enjoying the nice weather. But IÂ´m lucky enough I can walk to work.
At times I had to drive i usually just listened to some good music and chilled (though on the way home i sometimes just had to shout loudly in the car to leave a bad day behind me).
I miss walking to work.  When I was in the Dublin office, I was walking to work every day, it really was a nice thing to do.

Ah, it's still possible here in LA. I bike or walk to the office. You just have to give up everything else in order to afford the rent. :-)

When I do walk, I like listening to Audible audo-books or podcasts.

Yeah, I enjoy my slightly cheaper rent for more space and the ability to keep my cats :P

Maybe someday though!

>Yeah, I enjoy my slightly cheaper rent for more space and the ability to keep my cats :P

I like you

>ability to keep my cats :P

a lot

>cats

even more!

>cat***S***


#The most.
*internet highfive* :D
http://www.thatcutesite.com/uploads/2012/05/high_five_cat.jpg
iPad and music. The Times crossword. Warhammer Quest. Or sometimes, I watch something I downloaded on iPlayer. It's a 55 minute train journey.

This is the reason that I want to find a train into work.  I'd love to be able to work on my programming projects while traveling to work, as well as reducing the miles I put on my car, hah.

What are some downsides to trains/public transportation do you think?

In my experience? The fact that they are public...

As you said, there is the upside to being able to get work done, being able to read a book, or whatever. But, you also get the cases where there are no seats available, you are smashed in between people and can't really move to get any real work done, etc. It really depends on your particular commute and the structure of the public transportation.

If you decide to ever go that route, I would recommend trying out the public transportation at different times of day - it can be a vastly different experience depending on what time you use it.

If it's morning commute, I try not to fall asleep =o.
Commute home, I sing, or hum since I'm bad with lyrics, as loud as I can to KROQ or my phone music.
Rank the hotness of women. 1-10
Audio books. Going through wheel of time again, it's been 15 years since I started the series so it's all new again.

Wheel of Time?... I like your style.

Where did you get to when you stopped because be warned a few of the books later in the series REALLYYY slow down the story line. That said don't get discouraged it picks up at Knife of Dreams.

I've finished the whole series. I own all of them in physical and use a friends audible account that has all of them there. Currently getting them all in ebook so my wife can read them on the kindle.

I told my friend the same thing about books 7 and 8, but I think it's different when you're going back to back rather than waiting a couple years for the story to continue. He didn't notice any slowing of the story and was super excited about everything. 

I would also see any good movie made out of these books at least 10 times just to support making more. A BBC miniseries of each book would work too.

Short drive to work.. Stressful job so I like to listen to soothing music (typically Dean Martin and the boys) or listen to whatever Disney movie the kids were watching in the back seat (9/10 it's Tangled) these things just relax me and make the entry to my work day more barable ð

I usually chat with my wife if I go into the office (40min/50 mile freeway commute)  She prefers to drive and I don't mind having a sexy chauffeur.   I work from home a few days a week.  I don't gain much but some people inter-action (which is nice) by going in the office since my team is all over the US.

The days at home I make my fresh ground coffee and coffee while the laptop takes forever to boot up and login.  Gotta love corporate mandated encryption programs that decrease productivity.

I give speeches about things to myself in the car. I always imagine people looking at me think I'm using bluetooth... or that I'm crazy.

EDIT: Also NPR.
I take a nap while commuting, or play Conception on my PSP (It's the original Japanese version, there's no English format)
